meanings.definition: To give an order or instruction
meanings.sent1: The teacher commanded the students to sit quietly.
meanings.sent2: The general commanded his troops to advance.
meanings.sent3: The chef commanded the vegetables to jump into the pot!
meanings.sent4: The conductor's baton commanded the attention of the entire orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The king's decree commanded all citizens to attend the royal banquet.

meanings.definition: To be in control or have authority over
meanings.sent1: The captain commanded the ship through the stormy seas.
meanings.sent2: The CEO commanded a team of skilled professionals.
meanings.sent3: The cat commanded the household, ruling over the dogs.
meanings.sent4: The sun commanded the sky, casting its warm rays over the land.
meanings.sent5: The queen's presence commanded respect from all who met her.
